word.definition: very surprising or interesting
word.example: What an amazing story!

word.definition: to go to meet your colleagues
word.example: He has to attend regular team meetings in London.

word.definition: normal or typical
word.example: Average earnings here are around £20,000 per year.

word.definition: to say that you are not happy or not satisfied about sb / sth
word.example: People were complaining about waiting too long for their meals.

word.definition: one of several parts of sth
word.example: They sell replacement machine components.

word.definition: to think of new things, products, etc. and make them successful
word.example: We are developing a lot of new ideas.

word.definition: not as good as you hoped or expected
word.example: The sales figures this month were disappointing.

word.definition: very good
word.example: Her presentation was excellent.

word.definition: involving people who are together in the same place and looking at each other
word.example: I prefer to have face-to-face meetings with clients.

word.definition: extremely good
word.example: That’s fantastic news – well done!

word.definition: numbers that show different things
word.example: Can you send me the sales figures for this month?

word.definition: to think of ways of solving a problem
word.example: Our job is to identify problems and then find solutions.

word.definition: to decide what you will do or what should be done
word.example: You have to be able to make decisions quickly.

word.definition: your feelings or thoughts about sb / sth
word.example: We always want to hear our customers’ opinions.

word.definition: extra time that you spend working at your job
word.example: We get double pay for overtime.

word.definition: existing all the time or for a long time
word.example: They offered him a permanent job.

word.definition: liked by a lot of people
word.example: Their products are very popular with young people.

word.definition: a line of workers and machines in a factory that make, put together and check the parts of a product
word.example: She works on the production line at the chocolate factory.

word.definition: money that employees get monthly for doing their job
word.example: Her annual salary is €28,000.

word.definition: to find ways of dealing with difficult things or things that go wrong
word.example: He is very good at solving technical problems quickly.

word.definition: making you feel surprised, because you did not expect something
word.example: It’s surprising how easy it is to operate the machine.

word.definition: the activity of working well together as a team
word.example: She stressed the importance of good teamwork.

word.definition: existing only for a short period of time
word.example: I did a few temporary jobs while I was at college.

word.definition: the rate at which employees leave a company and are replaced by other people
